New Records: Lionel Messi became the second highest all-time international men's goalscorer, eclipsing Ali Daei with 109 goals.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi scored the winning goal in the 51st minute by redirecting a shot from Enzo Fernández into the net.
Julian Alvarez scored the first goal in the 42nd minute by finishing a pass from Rodrigo De Paul.
Pre-Game Insights: Jesse Marsch emphasized the importance of rotating players to maintain freshness in tournament play.
Canada’s coach acknowledged the need to develop more players to contribute and rotate in tournament play.
Post-Match Reflections: Jesse Marsch expressed pride in his team despite the loss and highlighted their strong performances throughout the tournament.
Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni called for European teams to participate in Copa America.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ismaël Koné's performance improved significantly in the second half, contributing to Canada's attacking play.
Canada lacked precision and coordination among their forwards, particularly Jacob Shaffelburg, Jonathan David, and Cyle Larin.
Others: Canada will face the winner of Uruguay vs. Colombia in the third-place game on Saturday, July 13.
Argentina will face the winner of Uruguay vs. Colombia in the final on Sunday, July 14.
